Back Bay fire and power outage aftermath

NStar: Power restoration to continue into Thursday

Only about half of the 12,000 customers who are still without power in Boston will have their electrical service restored by Wednesday night. (Boston Globe)
Pictures

Crews restoring power after city blackout

NStar crews and others worked to restore power to Boston's Back Bay after Tuesday night's transformer fire knocked out power.

'Whitey' Bulger's girlfriend pleads guilty

Greig pleads guilty to harboring a fugitive

A tearful Catherine Greig, girlfriend of gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, pleaded guilty today in federal court to helping him elude capture for 16 years. (Boston Globe)
  • Globe trial coverage on Twitter  |  More on 'Whitey' Bulger

Groups advise having fewer Pap smears

Leading medical groups offered new recommended schedules for cervical cancer screening and advised against annual Pap smears. (Boston Globe)

New US poll: Romney tops Santorum

Mitt Romney has opened a 9-point lead over Rick Santorum, but both GOP rivals fall behind President Obama in a new Pew Research poll. (Boston Globe)

Travel

Boston's Irish Heritage Trail

Explore more than 300 years of Irish-American history in Boston by following the Irish Heritage Trail. The tour consists of 20 stops along 3 miles, featuring many important historical events in the lives of those of Irish descent in the city and its surrounding area.
